group_1.textLeft: So, Ayaka, was it? What's troubling ya?

group_1.textRight: There's this girl named Shizuku.@She's my partner in crime, but...

group_1.narration: "Shizuku's really cool and has this funny sense@of humor. We don't agree on a lot of things, but@she's the only person who laughs at my jokes."
"She's supposed to be the one who@backs me up when I tell a gag, but lately…"

group_1.textRight: Look, look, Shizuku! This sushi roll's on a roll!
Shizuku doesn't laugh even a little!
It's like she doesn't get the joke at all!
Normally, she explains my more elevated@comedy.
I can't believe she's just ignoring me now!
What's the matter with you, Shizuku...

group_1.textLeft: So what kind of "elevated comedy" did you@show her?

group_1.textRight: For example, Shizuku is the daughter of@a coffee shop owner.
So let's go with something cafe-related.

She grinds up the coffee one bean at a time...@[chara:301901:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:301901:cheek_0][chara:301901:face_mtn_ex_011.exp3.json][chara:301901:motion_200][chara:301901:lipSynch_1]Even as the sun's going down!
Each cup of joe is made with a LATTE love!@How was that?

group_1.textLeft: …She doesn't laugh because they're not funny.
Takina is way too cold!@You gotta hold back some!

group_1.textRight: Hey, it is what it is. Maybe her jokes are just@too ahead of their time?

group_1.textLeft: Umm… Well, you said she usually laughs@at them, right?

group_1.textRight: She doesn't need to laugh per se, as long as@she gets a kick out of them!

group_1.textLeft: Well, she might just be acting as your foil.
Maybe it's not really about the joke's quality.
I wonder if there's something else that's@preventing her from reacting…
...I want to ask you something important, but@I need to know. What's your end goal, Ayaka?
Do you want her to laugh at your jokes?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, but I don't think forcing laughter is@a good idea for a comedian…

group_1.textLeft: Oh, you're a comedian...

group_1.textRight: I don't want to annoy people with my jokes,@but…
Well, she's my straight man, so I'll do whatever@it takes.
I want to get a reaction out of Shizuku!

group_1.textLeft: Alrighty! Then let's go make that happen!
We've gotta go find this Shizuku girl right away!
If the problem isn't with your jokes…
Maybe the issue is that something else is@bothering her. That's what I think.

group_1.textRight: Are you coming with me?!

group_1.textLeft: Of course! That's what a counselor should do@after all. Right, Emily?
That's what I'm talking about!@Full steam ahead!

group_1.textRight: …Is this really worth going out of your way?@Maybe she really is just tired of the jokes…

group_1.textLeft: If she's hearing jokes like that on a regular@basis...
Well, she'd have been bored with them from the@start. Her reaction wouldn't be changing, y'know?
I just feel like there's more to it.
Besides, they said it's a coffee shop!@You want to go there, don't you?

group_1.textRight: So, that's what you're after...
That's Shizuku, right there.
Oh... She looks totally spaced out.

group_1.textLeft: This isn't about the jokes after all, is it?

group_1.textRight: She seems to be absentmindedly drinking@coffee.

group_1.textLeft: Hm… This scene feels familiar…
Ah, that's it…@Like a grown-up right before a deadline.

group_1.textRight: What do you mean?

group_1.textLeft: At the store where we work, we have some@regulars who are writers.
They chug espresso with a thousand-yard stare,@saying they need it to stay awake.

group_1.textRight: Wow... Being an adult sure sounds tough...
…If Shizuku has the same look on her face as@those adults, then maybe…

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, maybe she didn't get enough sleep?
If that's the case, not even jokes could@cheer her up.

group_1.textRight: That explains it…!

group_1.textLeft: Well, let's ask her a few questions, shall we?
If she's been losing sleep, maybe something's@on her mind.
If we can solve that problem, won't Ayaka's@dilemma be fixed too?
…Aah, that's…Ayaka's…@I'm sorry for causing you trouble…
I'm sorry for ignoring your jokes, too, Ayaka.

group_1.textRight: I don't care about that!@If you haven't slept, you're going to sleep now!
You can rest on my lap!

group_1.textLeft: …It's fine.

group_1.textRight: So then, what's troubling you?@I'm sorry I didn't notice earlier!

group_1.textLeft: It's nothing, really… It's a family problem,@so I didn't want to trouble you about it.
Then maybe we can help?
After all, it's a counseling room.

group_1.textRight: We're not in the counseling room anymore.@We're proper counselors now.
Chisatochi is a professional who works in@a coffee shop, too!

group_1.textLeft: That's right, y'know? You can talk to me.

group_1.textRight: Um… Lately the sales at the coffee shop@haven't been very good.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, go on.

group_1.textRight: I'm trying to figure out how to attract@more customers…
I've read some books and done my own@research but…
I'm not sure what I should do…

group_1.textLeft: …I understand. You feel a bit stuck in the mud@right now, is that right?
*Giggle* Well, if that's the case!
Leave it to me and the other counselors,@okie-dokie?

group_1.textRight: Eh…?

group_1.textLeft: I've been asked to solve Ayaka's problem, but...
It seems like we'll have to help solve Shizuku's@dilemma first!
